item.title: Three Tasmanian men arrested, extradited to NSW over alleged harness racing drug syndicate
item.description: Three Tasmanian men are arrested following an investigation into an alleged drug syndicate linked to the harness racing industry across NSW and Tasmania.

item.title: Frida Kahlo painting sets new auction record for female artists
item.description: Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has become the most expensive female artist at auction, after her El sueno (la cama) painting sold for $US56 million.

item.title: Judge finds former teacher Helga Lam couldn't have known abuse of students would have caused harm
item.description: A former Sydney teacher cannot be held financially liable for engaging in sexual activity with four male students in the 1970s, after a judge found she could not be expected to have known her conduct would cause harm.

item.title: Labrador's dangerous dog declaration revoked by tribunal after family's appeal
item.description: A Geraldton family wins a months-long battle to overturn a council decision labelling their golden Labrador Dozer dangerous.

item.title: Dozens of birds killed in suspected poisoning attack on the Gold Coast
item.description: Animal rescue group WIRES says its concerned about dogs and children who use the park after more than 30 birds were found dead from a suspected poisoning.

item.title: Australia's legal system grappling with growing number of sovereign citizens clogging up courts
item.description: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

item.title: Varroa mite detected at Salt Creek, South Australia
item.description: The deadly bee parasite has been detected in South Australia again — this time in the state's south-east.

item.title: Murrumbidgee Local Health District to explore providing surgical abortions at Wagga Base Hospital
item.description: The Murrumbidgee Local Health District is exploring expanding reproductive health services so surgical abortions are available across a quarter of a million people in southern NSW.

item.title: Former Hobart teacher Keith Athol Bates-Willie sentenced for sexual abuse
item.description: Keith Athol Bates-Willie has been sentenced to 21 years' jail for raping and indecently assaulting a number of students between the late 1970s and the early 2000s.

item.title: WA musician Guy Ghouse dies, aged 56, after cancer battle
item.description: Western Australian musician Guy Ghouse dies at the age of 56 after a two year battle with cancer.

item.title: Health network boss apologises to Adelaide woman for spine surgery delays
item.description: An Adelaide woman says her elective surgery has been cancelled four times in the past few months as SA Health data shows nearly 25,000 people are waiting for elective surgeries across the state's public hospitals.

item.title: Man charged over theft of car with sleeping child inside
item.description: Victorian police have charged a man over the theft of a vehicle that had a sleeping toddler inside.

item.title: Former NSW CFMEU leaders, Darren Greenfield and son Michael, jailed over corruption
item.description: Former NSW union leaders, Michael Greenfield, and his son, Michael, have been sentenced to 10 months and six months in prison.

item.title: Fuel tanker racing to unload in Darwin ahead of Tropical Cyclone Fina
item.description: A fuel tanker is racing to unload diesel for the Northern Territory as Cyclone Fina approaches.

item.title: Adelaide Crows take Brisbane Lions dual-premiership player Callum Ah Chee in pre-season draft
item.description: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Five key takeaways from the inquest into the deadly 2022 Wieambilla shootings
item.description: A Queensland coroner has handed down his recommendations after an inquest into the attack that claimed the lives of two young police officers and a neighbour.

item.title: WA government commits further $147 million for new youth detention centre
item.description: The WA government pledges a further $147 million to fund the construction of a new youth detention centre in Perth to replace the notorious Unit 18.

item.title: Mitchell Starc registers career-best figures as England's 'unacceptable' batting style backfires
item.description: Mitchell Starc turns it on in the absence of Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood, as England's aggressive approach with the bat backfires spectacularly after Ben Stokes won the toss in the first Test.

item.title: Waste from Perth set to be trucked out to York after WA minister approves landfill site
item.description: The Western Australian environment minister has approved a new landfill site which will hold millions of cubic metres of waste trucked from Perth to a property near York.

item.title: Usman Khawaja criticised by Test greats for 'poor management' as back issues trigger little-known cricket rule
item.description: Usman Khawaja is criticised by several Australian Test greats after time off the field means he is forbidden from opening Australia's batting innings, exposing debutant Jake Weatherald.

item.description: Usman Khawaja's toilet break causes top-order chaos as Ben Stokes and Mitchell Starc star with the ball. Here are the quick hits from the first day of the opening Ashes Test in Perth.

item.title: Former Reform UK politician Nathan Gill jailed for taking bribes from pro-Russians
item.description: Nathan Gill, a hard-right British former politician and one-time ally of Reform UK leader Nigel Farage, pleaded guilty earlier to eight counts of bribery between December 2018 and July 2019.

item.title: Toy Story turns 30: How Pixar's animated buddy comedy went to infinity and beyond
item.description: Toy Story made history as the world's first computer-animated feature film. As it celebrates 30 years, we look back on the cinematic hit that sparked a technological revolution.

item.title: Europe invests in military while Trump spruiks Ukraine 'peace plan'
item.description: Europe is pouring resources into military production and coordination which will impact its agency as well as that of the United States.

item.description: Unshackled from legacy fossil fuel interests, the world’s clean energy future is being forged in the bustling cities of the global south.

item.description: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.description: Travis Head, promoted to open after Usman Khawaja suffered a back injury, scores a magical century in just 69 balls to lead Australia to a famous first-Test victory.

item.title: Australia records highest number of aircraft bird strikes in over a decade

item.description: A new face of Australia's housing crisis is emerging with companies making lucrative business out of university student tenants desperate to find somewhere to live.

item.title: Children take over their mother's case against Beauty Point caravan park following her death
item.description: In the last months of her life, Roslyn Grima was fighting in court for the right to sell her home at a tourist park to fund her cancer treatment, but died before that could happen. Now, her children will continue her battle.

item.title: Iranians fear taps running dry as country faces worst drought in 60 years
item.description: As Iran suffers through a drought and the president warns the capital could be evacuated, millions are worried about what the future will hold.

item.title: Big fines, little paid — the battle in Australia's illicit tobacco market
item.description: Data obtained in an ABC investigation shows the bulk of fines for selling illicit tobacco — tens of millions of dollars — are not being paid.

item.title: England coach Brendon McCullum urges Ashes calm after first Test loss
item.description: Brendon McCullum says England will find itself in trouble if it abandons Bazball now, with the team to double down on its aggressive tactics heading into Brisbane.

item.title: Infuriated Inverloch community 'still waiting' as FOI reveals years of delay in erosion works
item.description: Inverloch residents are "infuriated" by the Victorian government's delay in spending $3 million in federal funding to help fix coastal erosion.

item.title: Calls to end water extraction from Great Artesian Basin before culturally significant springs are lost
item.description: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

item.title: Heatwave conditions peak in Queensland, with severe storms forecast for south east
item.description: Parts of Queensland will reach 45 degrees Celsius today, while the state's south east braces for severe storms.

item.description: One Nation Leader Pauline Hanson has worn a burka on the floor of the Senate. Follow live.

item.title: Soccer journeyman Valentino Yuel travels around the world playing for different clubs
item.description: Since becoming a professional, Valentino Yuel has played in Australia's A-League, as well as for clubs in Türkiye, Iran, Qatar, Uzbekistan, Libya and now Hong Kong.

item.title: Markets live updates: BHP says no takeover deal with Anglo American, ASX rallies
item.description: Preliminary talks between miners BHP and Anglo American end without a deal. The ASX rebounds more than 1 per cent after renewed hopes of a December rate cut powered Wall Street higher. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

item.title: Body found in search for missing 18-year-old swimmer at Norah Head
item.description: A body has been found in a major land and sea search following a young man being swept out to sea on the NSW Central Coast.

item.title: For people like Benn, the hope of a fairer law on medicinal cannabis is life-changing
item.description: After years of chronic pain and legal uncertainty, a new bill could finally let NSW patients like Benn drive safely with medicinal cannabis.

item.title: Everything you need to know about life in Darwin in the wake of Cyclone Fina
item.description: As a new week begins for Top End residents still recovering from the damage caused by Tropical Cyclone Fina, questions remain for many about what happens next.

item.title: Retailers in north-west Victoria fed up with increasing crime rates amid proposed state law change
item.description: Retail stores in north-west Victoria are taking their own measures to curb increasing retail crime.

item.title: Premier League leaders Arsenal beat Spurs 4-1 in North London derby, moving six points clear
item.description: Eberechi Eze lights up the North London derby, his hat-trick giving Arsenal a big win over Spurs and extending the Gunners' Premier League lead.

item.title: Billion-dollar proposal to turn coal seam gas waste into valuable chemicals
item.description: Five million tonnes of salt could be dumped in ponds over the life of the coal seam gas industry. Now, there could finally be a better solution.

item.title: Domestic abuse survivors in PNG have to 'queue in front of the police station' to report their husbands
item.description: Women are twice as likely to suffer domestic violence in Papua New Guinea compared with the rest of the world, a new report finds. Here's what the country is doing to fix it.

item.title: Australian workers find it harder to change jobs, with concerns AI will cause further disruption
item.description: Australians are finding it harder to change jobs. It comes at a time when artificial intelligence is poised to further disrupt the workforce.

item.title: Wagga Wagga residents call for flood insurance probe amid rising premiums
item.description: There are growing calls for an investigation into the insurance classification of Wagga Wagga, with residents saying they are paying more for insurance now than they ever have.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores bicycle kick goal for Al-Nassr in Saudi Pro League
item.description: Veteran superstar Cristiano Ronaldo responds to a recent high-profile send-off with a brilliant bicycle kick for his Al-Nassr side in the Saudi Pro League.

item.title: Environmental experts challenge prescribed burn assessment in endangered bird habitat
item.description: Environmental and conservation experts in Western Australia challenge claims by Environment Minister Matthew Swinbourn that two endangered bird species were not present in a patch of Great Southern bushland set ablaze.

item.title: What did McLaren do wrong to get Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris disqualified from the Las Vegas F1 Grand Prix?
item.description: McLaren apologises to Norris and Piastri as F1 officials explain why the drivers were disqualified in Las Vegas.

item.title: Fifty kidnapped Catholic school students escape captors in Nigeria, more than 250 still being held
item.description: However, more than 250 students and 12 staff members are still being held, in what is one of the worst mass kidnappings ever recorded in the country.

item.title: China says Japan's PM 'crossed a red line' with Taiwan military intervention remarks
item.description: China's foreign minister has accused Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi of attempting to intervene militarily over Taiwan.

item.title: Hinchinbrook candidates reveal key policies amid tough by-election campaign
item.description: A hard-fought by-election in a north Queensland cane-growing district is growing more heated by the day.

item.title: The Wieambilla attack could not have been predicted, but extreme violence can be prevented
item.description: A coronial inquest does not fault police or the government for failing to pick up the curdling paranoia of the deluded Train family, but it does offer some paths forward.

item.title: Morgan Geyser, the woman behind a 2014 Slender Man stabbing, missing in Wisconsin
item.description: in 2014, Morgan Geyser and an accomplice nearly stabbed a classmate to death and later told police they did so to earn the right to be Slender Man's servants.

item.title: Sustainable and organic wines pique interest of young people
item.description: Central-west New South Wales winemaker Sam Statham has noticed a trend that has nothing to do with price or palate.

item.title: WA Spud King's newest supermarket revives memories of Kalgoorlie market gardens
item.description: The opening of a new supermarket franchise in one of Australia's biggest inland cities has revived memories from the past when Kalgoorlie-Boulder was home to at least 35 market gardens, run mostly by European migrant families.

item.title: Jeeno Thitikul retains LPGA's Tour Championship for biggest winning cheque in women's golf history
item.description: Thai world number one Jeeno Thitikul claims the biggest cheque in women's golf history, as Aussie Steph Kyriacou gets a final round hole in one at the Tour Championship.

item.title: Perth builder Nicheliving directors' homes raided by AFP, ASIC
item.description: Homes are raided and property seized as part of an ongoing investigation into embattled Perth builder Nicheliving.

item.title: Alcoa shelves plans to explore Perth Hills for bauxite mining expansion
item.description: US mining giant Alcoa will withdraw part of its plans to expand its mining operations in the world's only jarrah forests, following community concerns around water security and environmental impacts.

item.description: The 18-carat gold Jules Jurgensen pocket watch belonged to Isidor Straus, the co-founder of the Macy's department store.

item.title: Erin Phillips hired as GM to help Gold Coast Suns' struggling AFLW program
item.description: Erin Phillips joins the Gold Coast Suns as the club's new general manager of women's football as she looks to bring a premiership culture to this year's wooden spoon winners.

item.description: Emergency authorities are paying tribute to Country Fire Service firefighter Peter Curtis, who died in the line of duty at a conservation park on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

item.title: High-level trade talks between EU and US could have knock-on effects for Australia
item.description: The European Union will ask the United States to establish a "steel union" of higher tariffs and tighter import restrictions — which could have knock-on effects in Australia's steel sector — at crucial talks in Brussels on Monday.

item.title: ACT Supreme Court dismisses appeal against man jailed for raping friend
item.description: The first person sentenced for a sexual offence after a major review of cases previously rejected by ACT Police has had an appeal over his sentence dismissed.

item.title: SA Police to restart search for 4yo Gus, six mine shafts to be searched
item.description: SA Police says it will restart its search for four-year-old Gus, who went missing in the state's Mid North almost two months ago.

item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald provides an update on sidelined quicks Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood ahead of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

item.title: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters off Lancelin, as livestock vessel chief charged
item.description: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

item.title: Australian Michelin star chef Skye Gyngell dies aged 62
item.description: Skye Gyngell was born in Sydney into a prominent broadcast family but made her mark globally as a "culinary visionary who influenced generations of chefs".

item.title: ElecraNet to explore alternative options for Northern Transmission Project after farmers voice concerns
item.description: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

item.description: A Central Victorian drama and dance teacher is handed an 18-month jail term for raping a student at her home following an event.

item.description: The man's alleged attacker gave himself up to police at the scene of the incident and was charged with grievous bodily harm.

item.title: Sister of accused killer Rajwinder Singh gives evidence in Toyah Cordingley murder trial
item.description: The sister of the man accused of murdering Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley has told a court she has spoken to her brother "two or three times a week" since his extradition from India.

item.title: Spirit of Tasmania chair says auditor-general insolvency argument is 'absurd'
item.description: The auditor-general who said Tasmania's ferry operator was operating while insolvent, has been told his comments were "causing real harm to the company and its stakeholders".

item.description: A biopsy showed he had prostate cancer, to which the former British prime minister said, "You always dread hearing those words."

item.description: Brisbane returns to the AFLW grand final with a new game plan to tackle the unbeaten, reigning premiers.

item.title: The Trump presidency could be a priceless gift to Australia
item.description: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

item.description: Whether you're an employee counting down the days until your break, or an employer trying to keep a business open over Christmas — what are the rules about working these holidays?

item.title: Port Pirie clean-up efforts continue after thunderstorms slams SA town
item.description: Port Pirie residents and businesses are picking up the pieces after record-breaking thunderstorms hit town over the weekend.

item.description: The presenter will move to the NSW Weekend Mornings on Sundays, while NewsRadio's Thomas Oriti will step into the Drive hosting chair.

item.description: At the age of six, the complainant was allegedly told she had a "beautiful mission from God" to be the wife of William "Little Pebble" Kamm.

item.title: Man faces court charged over alleged car theft where toddler was left in a Shepparton car park
item.description: A man charged over the alleged theft of a car from a supermarket car park which had a toddler inside has faced court.
